website_summaries.verdict: Greenwork's tough 21-inch brushless self-propelled mower is worth considering if you don't have an extremely large yard and like the idea of mowing without ever needing to use fuel.
pros: A self-propelled mower that's powered by battery and can get as much as 40 minutes of run time per charge
21-inch deck is practical for small to medium-sized yards
Comes with a battery and charger
cons: Not as powerful as gas-powered mowers, so it's not ideal for large yards
Some tough, dense grass may require more than one pass

customer_reviews.title: Battery time on self propelled is short
customer_reviews.text: Don’t believe advertising on a quarter acre for 40 minutes I got about 25 minutes out of battery so make sure to order a second one
customer_reviews.author: Lou G

customer_reviews.title: Women friendly!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I rolled it out of the box, snapped the handle bars in place and charged the battery. I have not put the bag on yet, but when I popped the battery in, pushed a button it gave a little purrrr...and I was off cutting my front yard!! It did such a great job, I am disabled to where I cannot walk a lot especially if I were pushing something heavy, but this is self propelled so I did not feel any pressure just walking and guiding it along. i`m sure I`ll learn more about it but this was my first immediate experience and Iwas so happy not to deal with fuel and oil etc..
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia L.

customer_reviews.title: A life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Oops! Left a review for one I returned, unopened! Lol. This one had the battery with it where the other one didn’t. Wasn’t sure my current battery wiukd work with it and needed that assurance. The nice thing about this is that the casing is metal. Not sure the other one would have been. Same brand. Just slightly different mower. This is a dream compared to one that’s not self propelled. Just don’t have the physical capabilities to use a push mower anymore. What a difference self propelled makes!! So happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: yelkcub

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: this thing is so easy to use and its power supplied by a battery that lasts forever and it comes with the charger so when you're not mowing your lawn you can easily power up the battery and put it to the side so when you need it the next time. this lawn mower is super quiet and it has a built-in mulcher and comes with its own leaf bag and I have to say I would not go to another lawn mower. It can go super slow for even the oldest person or you can up the ante and turn on the rabbit switch that allows you to go at a very quick Pace if you wish to.
customer_reviews.author: airforce

customer_reviews.title: Lawnmower Relief
customer_reviews.text: No more gasoline, noise, or heavy mower, especially when bag is fill. What a relief - press the start button and pull the bar back and off I go. My neighbors can't believe how quiet the machine is. Hopefully this machine will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Ann A.

customer_reviews.title: Need better batteries
customer_reviews.text: The battery lasted about 20 minutes, far less than advertised. *update *** aside from the battery (there is an offbrand battery for like 50 bucks that's just as good as the greenworks one for half the price) The shoot clogs with grass way too easy which makes you have to flip the mower over to clean it out every few minutes and it's infuriating
customer_reviews.author: TImmylaw

customer_reviews.title: Love this mower but battery life not great. Buy a spare!
customer_reviews.text: I had the smaller version of this mower but then moved to a larger yard so had to go bigger. I love this mower. I am a female and find it very easy to use. The cut does seam off sometimes but only when I let my grass get out of control and I probably don't go slow enough for it to do its job properly. Also, the battery life is not great if you use the self propel and have a large lot.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Huprich

customer_reviews.title: Great mower!
customer_reviews.text: This mower is great. It’s made it through high, wet grass, dry grass, thick grass. It cuts beautifully . It’s a tad heavy for this old lady and it took me a bit to control it on self propel but I’ve got it now. Starts with ease. I love that it self propels without the cutting blade on. Making it easy to get in and out of the garage. The 6 volt battery covers my backyard as well as 95% of the front. Worth every penny. No regrets about purchasing this mower.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Self propelled drive failed out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The self propelled drive made a loud clicking noise with the first use. It was not longer in stock at Amazon so I could not exchange it with Amazon. I called the manufacture and they sent me a replacement. The replacement arrived in a box that was full of holes and looked like something smashed the box. I never took the replacement out of the box as i was not willing to accept it with so much damage. I returned the original to Amazon and the mower from the manufacture back to them. This was a HUGE problem getting it back to the manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: mesa azTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good mower but has quirks.
customer_reviews.text: I really like battery powered lawn mowers. This one works okay but has a few quirks. First the body is made out of steel which makes it heavy. Second the self-powered feature works good but you have to release the power handle then go forward about 6 inches before the gears release. Third the battery is very very difficult to remove. I attribute these items to poor product testing. Other than those items it does cut good and is easy to use. I purchased a 4 amp hour battery and get about 20 to 25 minutes of lawn cutting with some minor slopes.
customer_reviews.author: Poolman499

customer_reviews.title: Nice product when it works.
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed. Lots of options. 1 major design safety flaw. The bar that activates the drive function sticks above the handle causing the mower to drive away uncontrolled. Corrected by bending the bar away from the handle and foam pad. Shouldn't have to do this. Battery life is about 15 minutes. Photos show charger indicating complete (green light). Indicator on battery shows no charge. New battery. Its been in the charger for 2 hours. Supposed to charge in 1. This is just another very expensive electric toy until they can make a battery that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: cb

customer_reviews.title: Nice mower.
customer_reviews.text: Most complaint of difficulty removing the battery but I have not had any problem at all and I don’t have full strength in my hands anymore. It is night and day, using this vs one that is not self propelled. SO glad I finally broke down and got it! And prefer a battery vs gas, as well. Sometimes I do have to make another pass to cut it all but find if I go slower that doesn’t seem to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: yelkcub

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  sturdy, quiet lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: I love my battery operated lawn mower! Sturdy, easy to use, quiet. Works well with either the grass-catcher or the mulching block. Good speed adjustment lever to propel mower at your pace. I had the 4 amp and smaller 2 amp batteries from previous Greenworks purchases. With the two batteries I get a total of 45 minutes cutting time, which is sufficient for my needs. One minor design flaw - there is not enough room for your fingers to pull out the battery for charging. The MacGyver in me made a sling to pull up the battery, problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Swordmaestro

customer_reviews.title: does not mow long  before both batteries are out of power
customer_reviews.text: I received the first mower and it had been used or refurbished so it didn't work long until it quit got in touch with someone at Amazon and received a replacement last Friday decided to use it today Monday I mowed about thirty minutes and used both of my batteries one was 2,0 amp the other a 2.5 amp I am trying to return it because it does not work well at all sorry I ever bought it,I will give it 1 star because it folds up out of the way will stick with my Snapper 20 inch gas mower
customer_reviews.author: Paul E Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: We have used this sweet little machine for the past few months because we are in self isolation. My husband and I are 80 years old, so we needed something easy to handle. We had to buy a second battery because one battery will do either half the front or half the back yard without replacement. It literally takes us two days do do the mowing, but it is self-propelled, and we mulch the grass. We just love this mower.
customer_reviews.author: Kitchen Diva

customer_reviews.title: ... it's design parameters and it has proven to be excellent. Our mountain cabin has a very rough "yard" ...
customer_reviews.text: I am using this mower far outside it's design parameters and it has proven to be excellent. Our mountain cabin has a very rough "yard" or fire break of clump grass, rocks and wood debris. Charlene wanted a self propelled mower and I already have some Greenworks tools so got this mower. I was concerned that it would not stand up to the primitive conditions but it has and I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: No, not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I am a 60yr old woman with back issues yet relatively strong. I used this mower twice. I have a “postage stamp” yard, front and back. The battery died after doing the front and just beginning the back. It is reasonably easy to operate with the power assist. On my second use it shut down twice trying to get through grass mowed just a week before. It does not have a stable quality feel. This being my first battery operated mower I’m not sure I am the best judge but for the price, no I would not recommend this mower. I have returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: jessies mom

customer_reviews.title: quiet
customer_reviews.text: we bought the smaller one of these mowers and liked it so well, My husband wanted a bigger , badder, self propelled, one. so we got this one and he loves it. the neighbors that want to sleep late love it too. It is quiet. I don't think one battery charge will do the entire yard. but because we got a new lawn mower, we have new snow now so we will see.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but battery drains very quickly when using self propelled feature. Need to have at least two batteries on hand and they know this because there is onboard storage for two batteries. Batteries are very expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Grimmy77

customer_reviews.title: Great simple and powerful machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing; one takes it out of the box, charges the battery, and voila’. I’ve done 4 cuts so far. Less trouble than my former gasoline-powered mower. I believe it is less noisy, too, thiugh there is considerable noise (unlike an electric car). Plenty of power to do the job. Assembly is a 10-minute job.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Vanbuskirk

customer_reviews.title: A bear to move in small yards
customer_reviews.text: I loved my first greenworks mower. This one however is a bear to use. I have a small yard and moving the self propelled mower backwards is very hard. If it had a reverse or the power wheels were on the front it might be easier to use.. you have to drag the mower backwards constantly because the self propelled wheels don’t move backwards easily. Guess is I had a long, flat lawn this would be perfect. Plus the wheels are plastic and don’t grip on hill well. It does Cut nice in the long parts of my yard.. battery life is about 25 mins using both batteries.. overall I’m disappointed with this model
customer_reviews.author: Bill L.

customer_reviews.title: It is quiet and very light compared to the old Toro
customer_reviews.text: When considering battery life, take into consideration whether you are using the power drive(self propelled) and how long the grass is. I will probably get another battery but I will wait until more experience is accumulated. Otherwise it is so nice I wish I got it earlier. I can't wait until next season. Also there is a USB port on the battery that I have used a few times already to charge a laptop and iPhone....
customer_reviews.author: ATW

customer_reviews.title: Works mostly as expected, some quirks though
customer_reviews.text: To my surpise single included 6 AH battery was sufficient to cut my ~8000 sq.f. lawn on single charge. Some problems I experienced is inability to move back (wheels locked occasionally when motor is disengaged) and bluetooth link for battery connection to phone is pointing to non-existent entry in Playstore. Other then that exactly what I hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Don't
customer_reviews.text: Great "Green" mower if you have a flat lawn, it is very dry and short. Expect to purchase 1-2 additional batteries. For an average lawn, the batteries will run 10-15 minutes max, then you cannot recharge them right away because of flaws in the charger base that think the battery is fully charged and in reality it is dead. Nice concept, but not ready for prime time. Wait another couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: F. Caputo

customer_reviews.title: Good Greenworks self propelled mower.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Greenworks 40V non self propelled mower for years. But now I needed a self propelled one. The batteries don’t last as long which is logical since the batteries now also have to power the wheels. One thing I wish it had was a place for two active batteries (like my old Greenworks mower) when the first battery was used up it would switch automatically to the second one. Other than that - I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Koller

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE from Greenworks & missing parts upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: I waited 53 minutes to get through via phone after sending two emails a week apart and never getting a response. The package was missing the manual and any kind of supportive paperwork! I could not get the lower handles to release in order to assemble the upper handles. It was completely locked in the down position. When I finally reached a live person, she knew nothing and could not help - after SHE had put me on another 23 minute hold!! This is an expensive mower - over $535! and I can't even get the handles to raise up! and NO help from GREENWOKS - completely unresponsive to calls or emails....
customer_reviews.author: lynn preston

customer_reviews.title: THIS MOWER ROCKS
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS THE BEST . AND THIS IS THE FUTURE .....THE ONLY THING I FOUND WAS THAT THE DRIVE SHAFT FOR THE MOTOR WAS ALREADY RUSING UP AND SLIGHTLY PITTED. I SANDED IT DOWN AND PAINTED IT . THE CHINESE HAVE (ALWAYS ) HAD A PROBLEM WITH THEIR CRAPPY STAINLESS STEEL . OTHER TAN THAT IT ROCKS. THE WORX COMBO EDGER WEED EATER IS ALSO THE BOMB . MAKE SURE IF YOU GERT ONE THEY DONT SELL YOU THE OLDER MODEL WHICH IS OK BUT THE NEW ONE IS A LOT BETTER ..........THEY DUPED ME ON THAT .
customer_reviews.author: Fred Brown

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I love my new mower. I can mow a large area before the battery runs out. I purchased a second battery, however I need an extra charger to keep my spare battery charged. The second battery is not fully charged as I am mowing. I have to wait a couple of hours to mow the rest of my lawn. It handles weeds and junk lawn really well when you use the high setting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lawnmower works great. I have a steep hill in the front ...
customer_reviews.text: Lawnmower works great. I have a steep hill in the front of the yard and I have no problem with it. I especially like the ease with which I can adjust the cutting height with one lever, and I like the variable blade speed for handling denser patches of grass.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. McCord

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The perfect mower. Easy to maneuver, starts with a push of a button, no gasoline and no pollution, self propelled and folds. What more can we ask to a mower that is not more expensive than other with less features? Only negative is that the battery is very expensive and buying a cheaper one really doesn't work. But the same battery can be used with any greenworks tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mypenname

customer_reviews.title: keeps breaking down
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because of the reviews. After mowing the lawn 3 times the self propelled part of the mower broke. It took me almost 2 months to get the mower fixed after i turned it in to the repair shop. I finally got it back a few days ago and when I tried to start it, the mower stared for about 10 seconds . It won't start at all. Now I have to take it to the shop again. This mower has given me no satisfaction at all. I wouldn't recommend it at all
customer_reviews.author: William J. Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Great Battery Powered Lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Battery Powered Lawnmower. No more Gasoline to buy. Built good, Brushless, Self Propelled. The battery gets a little hot after about 45 minutes, needs to cool down, then good again. Sounds like a big Vacuum Cleaner. My granddaughter put velcro on the handle and walked behind, no need to push, she couldn't hardly keep up (Not a good idea). Easy to maneuver, easy to assemble and light weight. Great Value for the Money. Comes with Battery and Charger. Charges in about 3 hours. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholics Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Buy a higher voltage than 40....
customer_reviews.text: I love the light weight, long battery life, fast charging, eas of use. I would have got a higher voltage unit. 40 volt not powerful enough. You have to go over the grass sometimes two times. Also mover won’t go in reverse easy. You have to stop and try 2-3 times to unlock wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A.

customer_reviews.title: Great self-propelled mower!
customer_reviews.text: I'm retired, so mowing the lawn should be good exercise. The self-propelling feature on this mower makes mowing the grass more like going for a walk. Love it! The grass looks great, too.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Putting the fun back into mowing.
customer_reviews.text: I like this mower so much I wish I could mow every day. I’m 73 years old and so I don’t even want to mow my whole lawn in one day unless it’s really cool. But the one time I tried it it lasted. The self-propelled feature works like a charm and is very easy to adjust between turtle and rabbit even on the move. My yard is about a .3 Acre. There is no warning that the battery is going to run out. I appreciate not having to fool around with stinky gas. The neighbors have commented on how quiet the mower is. I’m the only person in my neighborhood who doesn’t have a riding mower.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES KIEFER

customer_reviews.title: Great. when it worked.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mower used, new condition, and it did arrive looking new. Used the battery that came with my trimmer and got 20-25 minutes of mow time then battery died, Called Greenworks, and after a long wait, (40 minutes) they said I needed the larger battery. Ordered it, and also only received 20 minutes mow time. Loved it when it worked, possible I got a lemon. Returned
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: self propelled wonder
customer_reviews.text: just what we were looking for, live in the mountains and part of our lawn is sloped this mower pulled up it like nothing. We have a good sized lawn and this mower does a fine job, would get 5 stars but it is hard to turn around.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Blair

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Not toy. Never drive for gas again.
customer_reviews.text: Second electric mower. First was green works as well. Thought maybe junk. Wasn’t. Bought another with power wheel drive. I had a Honda gas mower for years. Bullet proof. This one is too. Never drive to gas station for gas and stink up your car. Plug removable battery in. I would suggest buying an extra battery if you have limited time to mow.
customer_reviews.author: PoorRick

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Handles the thick Florida St. Augustine grass and can complete the whole lawn with one charge. It is durable with the metal deck and easy to fold up and store away.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Foss

customer_reviews.title: Worst self propelled mower
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the worst self propelled mower ever. It has never worked when you engage the self propelling option. Cuts ok
customer_reviews.author: richard h. forster

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mower to replace/upgrade an older 36VDC model. Newer battery technology makes for much lighter units but with even better life. Mower cuts well and with a variable speed drive, I can adjust the walking speed to a comfortable pace. We have a fairly large yard and the 2 batteries allow completing the complete plot with power to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Stuht

customer_reviews.title: Saving me a lot of time, just in starting alone.
customer_reviews.text: It's so nice not to have to fight with the starter rope and flooding. I just pop in the charged up battery, push the button and away I go. I did find out that it doesn't like areas of deep or thick grass, so I take those areas slower. It did cause the battery to wear down a bit faster than previous times. If that keeps up, I may have to order an additional battery, but they are a bit expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Charline Huwe

customer_reviews.title: My first electric and I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: My lawn is roughly 2.000 sq. ft., so it's small. One battery runs the mower and a Greenworks blower with no sign of depletion. The self propelled controls take some getting used to, but I had it mastered by the end of the first mowing. Absolutely no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: BobinCinti

customer_reviews.title: Self propelled stop working 3 months after gently use
customer_reviews.text: 3 moths of use once a week. I was very happy with it as first time i use battery operated mower. Then self propelled option stop working. Things happens, that is fine, then i tried to contact Greenworks to check with them as it is still under warranty with no luck. They put you in 4 to 5 hrs waiting time. once you get connected, they take your number so they claim will call you if the line get disconnected and never call. The customer service is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smooth drive and easy mowing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to use finished my job in very less time compared to my old cable driven greenworks mower. Hope it will not disappoint me in long run. Battery life was good I did not run into any problems so far, for 5000sqft lawn. Let’s see how it goes and I will update my comments if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: NewUser

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice mower.
customer_reviews.text: It does a very good job. The self propel seems to suck up a lot battery power. The speed controller is mounted in a way that it gets caught on fences and hedges and the speed gets changed inadvertently. It is very quiet. Even with the caveats, I would recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis W. Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Very light, easy start. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I believe ALL battery operated lawn mowers are overpriced. Although in the pricing scheme the Greenworks is priced well within the whole overpriced battery operated mower market.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: discontinued
customer_reviews.text: Getting a replacement battery for this is difficult and expensive due to being a discontinued model sold through Amazon. Would have been nice to know this before shelling out $500.
customer_reviews.author: Deb G.

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: My rating is in reference to my overall approval without actually using it. The grass is not high enough yet to cut, but overall the self-propelled feature is powerful and the mower is virtually quiet when the blade is spinning. It sounds like one of those industrial fans that you seen on work sites or warehouses. I will give an update to this sometime during the summer of '19.
customer_reviews.author: nthfrl

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, bad battery life, good options
customer_reviews.text: I like the options the lawnmower has but the batteries to run it cost too much and you have to buy multiple batteries because if you buy the best battery they have, the 5ah one, you can only run it for 20 mins. The 4ah one is 10-15 mins. Bad purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Castro

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as hoped....
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the spare slot for a second battery is not live, like my previous Greenworks mower & it's a bit of a pain to have to switch batteries, unlike my old one where the power just came from one then the other battery. Does not turn very easily at all, more like not at all, unless I'm doing something wrong!!
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Battery life don't last 40 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: They say the battery last half an acre, I have to charge the battery three times on my .34 acre yard. You'll be able to mow about .15 acres before the battery dies. If a company says something goes to .5 acres I don't expect you to get half an acre all the time but I can't even get a quarter of an acre out of the battery life even half of what they say you get. It's a good lawn mower just false on the amount of time and distance you get out of the life of the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: great lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the self-propelled mower to make the hills in my backyard easier to handle. Also purchased an extra battery and glad I did. Love this mower. No regrets. The mower does the work. I get a nice walk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't sure but love it!
customer_reviews.text: First electric device I have bought and I was worried but I love this lawn mower. It is quiet, cutes well and light weight. I bought the self propelled model and I don't use it that much. It is light enough that it is easier for me to push the speed I want to go. The self propel isn't like a gas lawnmower there is a little delay before it kicks in. Overall, very happy with this lawn mower!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nescau

customer_reviews.title: Not brand new.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this, I bought it brand new. I just pulled it out of the box and I can see all of these scratches. Definitely NOT brand new. I want part of my money back since this is a refurbished lawn mower not BRAND NEW.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Get extra batteries
customer_reviews.text: The batteries on ALL of the green works are hard to get out of their chargers- especially if you have adult sized fingers or finger nails. Even the items that have a push up release dont work. Guess a man designed these. What a shame because I otherwise appreciate the machines.
customer_reviews.author: Chef

customer_reviews.title: Works well but BATTERY DIFFICULT TO REMOVE!
customer_reviews.text: This mower does a great job at mowing and the battery life is fair. I can get my front lawn done with one charge, but I have to recharge for the back. The biggest problem is THE BATTERY IS DIFFICULT TO REMOVE! IT'S IN A NARROW CORNER WHERE MY TINY FINGERS CAN'T FIT! IT TAKES HOURS OF FIGHTING AND BLACK AND BLUE FINGERNAILS! 🤦‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: LordReppin

customer_reviews.title: battery lasts a long time
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lawnmower for grass only. I wouldn't try to mow heavy weeds and things like that,but forgrass it's great. When I get tired I can always use the rear wheel drive to make mowing easier. Battery last long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mower
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this mower. The 21 inch width is great and the variable speed is definitely nice to have. Cleaning is a breeze and folding it for storage a plus. I have cut my lawn 3 times with it on the highest cut setting which is about how I usually cut my grass. Not a big issue. The only real issue is not with the mower but with the battery life. It takes about an hour to cut my lawn and the battery last about 20 minutes at best.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: None of the first items they shipped worked so we were afraid of a defective mower also, so shipped it back....Greenworks, need to make sure the stuff you ship works!!!
customer_reviews.author: Driggs118

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: After using it about 5 times I recommend, you get a second battery if you have a large yard. But it was easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: ktlove

customer_reviews.title: Horrible battery life
customer_reviews.text: Says the battery will last 70 minutes. False. Doesn’t even last 30. Other than that love the machine but doubt I will buy a new battery, will most likely buy another brand because I have no faith that another battery will last any longer and i will end up with 2 batteries (more money) that still doesn’t last 70 minutes
customer_reviews.author: brandi wilsie

customer_reviews.title: Lousy electric mower
customer_reviews.text: Am very disappointed in this mower. It does cut grass well but the battery life sucks. I have a big yard and it takes three days to mow as the battery keeps going dead. Would probably work better on small yard But I wouldn't recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheyennejochec

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: The lawmower is quiet but powerful. Its handling is an easy adjustment that feels great.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco P.

customer_reviews.title: Great mower except for replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: What a battery power mower. Only problem I've had so far is trying to find rear wheel drive wheels for it. When I've contacted greensworks, they have no idea what I'm talking about, even when I present them with the product number.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R

customer_reviews.title: Best all round
customer_reviews.text: The Lawnmower is marvelous. I only returned one because For some reason I got two! But probable my mistakes
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great overall. Good battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and folds for great storage. We have a .3 acre lot and can do almost all of it on one charge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Help with blade problem?
customer_reviews.text: I don't think the blade is working. I really want to like this mower. Help!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer D.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, lightweight, great product except the battery
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, lightweight, great product except the battery. I have a 1/2 acre and I had to recharge the battery 3 times to complete it. The product is great, but if you buy another battery you should be fine for a medium to small lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schelling

customer_reviews.title: features
customer_reviews.text: no body commented on the fact that when mower runs out of steam and won't cut, press the self propel bar, and it can walk itself back to the barn!! plesntly suprised.
customer_reviews.author: john m.

customer_reviews.title: This mower does a great job and the self propelled works great
customer_reviews.text: I have a small yard however it is on a slight hill and i'am in my eights. This mower does a great job and the self propelled works great.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Countryman

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: I am ambulatory disabled and assembly challenged but this mower is terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Mosaic Marketing

customer_reviews.title: Great mower for small yards.
customer_reviews.text: Great mower, gets about 1/3 acre before battery runs out. In retrospect I should've gotten the 80V version for my 1 acre yard.
customer_reviews.author: SkizzoYo

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It cuts well and is easy to store. I did use a second battery for a relatively small yard, but it is very easy to remove and install. I am also led to believe the batteries will hold more charge after about 5-6 charges.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore M.

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why ,I only use less than 4 months. The engine got smoke and doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great mower!
customer_reviews.text: Great mower! This is my second one. My son liked the first one so much that I gave it to him and got myself this self propelled model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get a second battery.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the mower. I got the pro series thinking that the battery life would be better - it only gets through half of my yard (lot is less than 1/4 acre). And, whomever designed the grip and location of the battery failed miserable as it is very difficult to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Luke

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous
customer_reviews.text: Tremendous. I love the greenworks mower. I have 2 40v batteries and it’s great with the self-propelled feature. I conserve battery by pushing one way and using self-propelled going up hill. This is such a great tool
customer_reviews.author: Boomer B

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to assemble. It’s so easy to work. I love the self propelled feature. Use a bigger battery and you can do a big yard in one battery cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Evy Weisberg

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time!
customer_reviews.text: The lawnmower doesn't work in hot climates like Texas. Just buy a real lawnmower.
customer_reviews.author: B.Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Folds up and locks taking minimal garage space
customer_reviews.text: Powerful, great self propel lawn mower. I love the way it folds up and locks in to place for storage. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Linda D.

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as other Greenworks products
customer_reviews.text: Not great traction with self propelled wheels and bogs down easily on rough terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Works Better Than A Gas Mower!
customer_reviews.text: This is so surprising. This mower works just as well as a gas mower but is much quieter! Actually it works better because I don't have to worry about having gas! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Badyen

customer_reviews.title: Larger capacity battery would improve its usability
customer_reviews.text: Used for mowing lawn - have to recharge battery quite frequently - more lawn than battery
customer_reviews.author: DONALD G BENNETT

customer_reviews.title: Battery mower
customer_reviews.text: Good mower for small yard, but hard to pull backwards after self propel is disengaged
customer_reviews.author: Ron J

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: The battery does not last even for a 1/4 acre yard.. I have to mow what I can and then wait 3 hrs for battery to charge to mow other half.. And that’s PUSHING it whole time not even using self propel option..
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic. Works as good as my gas powered mower
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic. Works as good as my gas powered mower, but no more gas, oil, sparkplugs, noise, and pulling and pulling to get it started.
customer_reviews.author: myorion7

customer_reviews.title: Corrected review
customer_reviews.text: I miss read the inventory. This model doesn't come with battery or charger-my mistake. Otherwise, pleased with order.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Mathis

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Takes a little getting use to
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Takes a little getting use to. Different style handle than my 15yr old gas mower. 5amp battery plus a little from my 2.5amp battery does my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Jerald Bain

customer_reviews.title: Battery life way too short.
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is totally unacceptable. I have a .3 acre yard and the mower can only cut 1/3 of it before the battery runs out .
customer_reviews.author: Helen Cheer

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 batteries and they don't last through mowing my lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Ainslie

customer_reviews.title: Great mower
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the mower for me. I really like mulcher feature to use on leaves.
customer_reviews.author: kr

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and I like the adjustable self-propelled portion of the mower
customer_reviews.author: DMcQuade

customer_reviews.title: This is a good quality mower with nice features
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality mower with nice features. If you have a large lawn I recommend buying an extra 5 ah battery from Greenworks. Don't waste your time and money with immitations
customer_reviews.author: Texas Racing

customer_reviews.title: Blade not engaging
customer_reviews.text: Got the lawnmower, engine engages, wheels are spinning but the blade isn’t spinning. First order was lost somewhere, second one came early but now has a defect. Third time is the charm!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Dual battery would be much nicer. Self propel makes even tall grass easy. Buy bigger batteries
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Easy start and clean cut
customer_reviews.text: I love this mower! I don’t have a lot of strength in my hands so the push button start is wonderful. Took me a bit to adjust to the rear wheel self propel. Nice clean cutting and does my yard on 1 full battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A big mistake to buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Battery last 10 minutes working, 8 hours charging, the cuts are irregular, the machine as a hall is a rob.
customer_reviews.author: werner s ahlers

customer_reviews.title: Great mower, love the self propelled feature...GREAT BATTERY LIFE!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mower. I did a lot of research, but you still don't know if it's a good fit. THIS ONE IS!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mower is quiet
customer_reviews.text: The mower is quiet compared to gas. It cuts well except when grass is wet. Easy to assemble and use. Would recommend two batteries if you have a very large lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Roger H

product_meta.title: Greenworks 21-Inch 40V Brushless Self-Propelled Mower 6AH Battery and Charger Included, M-210-SP
product_meta.description:
Style:6Ah Battery & Charger Included40V Greenworks Tools, our battery fueled outdoor power equipment is ideal for homeowners who want the perfect outdoor space. Our 40V is best for yards up to ½ acre. This universal 40-volt battery system powers more than 50+ products, that is over 50 products that run off the same 40V battery. Having multiple batteries allows you to be using one, charging one, and you’ll never run out of power. The Greenworks family of 40V tools has more outdoor equipment in our platform than any other manufacturer. Our tools provide powerful performance with plenty of runtime to get any job done quickly, efficiently, quietly and all with no emissions. Greenworks’ high quality equipment has a quick push-button start, light weight, easy to use and uses no gas. Lawn mowers, string trimmers, blowers, and much more. 

Greenworks, Life gets Easier.
feature_bullets: Durable 21" steel deck allows you to handle large areas of grass quickly and easily
Brushless motor provides more torque, quiet operation, and longer life - Self-propelled rear wheel drive can be easily adjusted to your stride
USB port in battery charges all portable electronic devices, including phones and tablets
3-In-1 design allows you to mulch, rear bag, or side discharge your grass clippings
Dual battery port design enables one battery to be stored while the other fuels the mower for uninterrupted cutting; saving you a trip to the garage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars309 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
